meanings.definition: To put forward or suggest (an idea or argument)
meanings.sent1: She propended her viewpoint during the debate.
meanings.sent2: He propended a new theory in his research paper.
meanings.sent3: The student propended a creative solution to the math problem.
meanings.sent4: His proposal propended a fresh approach to the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's idea propended a fun class activity.

meanings.definition: To incline or lean towards a particular opinion or course of action
meanings.sent1: They propended towards going to the beach for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She propended towards choosing the blue paint for the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat propended towards sleeping in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: His heart propended towards helping those in need.
meanings.sent5: The tree propended towards the river, seeking more sunlight.
